parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Client Token, used to ensure the idempotence of requests. Generate a unique value for this parameter from your client for each request. ClientToken supports only ASCII characters. Note that if you do not specify this, the system will automatically use the RequestId of the API request as the ClientToken identifier. The RequestId may differ for each API request.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The ID of the region to which the route target group instance belongs. You can obtain the region ID by calling the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) interface.

parameters.name: RouteTargetGroupDescription
parameters.description:
Description of the route target group. 

The description length should be between 1 to 256 characters and must not start with http:// or https://.

parameters.name: RouteTargetGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the route target group instance.

parameters.name: RouteTargetGroupName
parameters.description:
The name of the route target group.

The name length should be between 1 and 128 characters, and cannot start with http:// or https://.

parameters.name: RouteTargetMemberList
parameters.description:
List of members in the route target group.
Under the primary-standby mode, there are the following restrictions on the members of the route target group:
1. The number of members in the route target group must be 2. 
2. The members of the route target group must belong to different availability zones.
